newsitem.title: UK: Airtours up as loss narrows, bookings perk up.
newsitem.headline: Airtours up as loss narrows, bookings perk up.

text.p: Shares in Airtours Plc rose 18p to 962-1/2p on Wednesday as first-half results and bookings news cheered the market, analysts said.
Winter pre-tax losses narrowed by 45 percent to 12.67 million stg, about two million less than the market expected.
"We will be examining our figures for the year but not until after we've talked to the company this morning. But they certainly won't be going down," said one analyst.
Airtours said booking levels and load factors for this summer are "showing appreciable gains".

UK tour operations summer 1997 bookings are 28.8 percent ahead of last year and winter 1997/98 bookings are 49.7 percent higher than the winter just past, the company said. Summer 1998 bookings are ahead of the company's expectations, it said.
